result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Harvey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Cases heard: 15CF523 & 16CF10, Defendant Robert J Harvey in court with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  ADA Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waivers of Preliminary Hearing filed in each case. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Informations filed, reading waived.
Hearing on August 2, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - DNA taken
Filed by defendant/counsel.
Filed by defendant/counsel.

2:19pm/3:10pm Defendant Robert J Harvey in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Clifford Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases heard: 15CT126, 15CF523 & 16CF10.  Probable cause exists.  Defendant pleads no contest  to count 1 in 15CT126, count 1 in 16CF10 & count 1, 2 & 3 in 15CF523.  Court will accept plea and adjudge guilty and enter JOC on those counts.  In 15CT126 court imposes Ct 1: 10 days jail with huber, $1442.00 due 60 days or pay plan., 13 month revocation & IID, $65.00 blood draw costs due 60 days or pay plan., AODA.  6 days jail credit.  Count 2 dismissed.  Court imposes in 16CF10 count 1: sentence w/held 3 years probation concurrent to 15CF523 with conds: 45 days jail with huber, $518.00 fine, DNA sample, no contact with AJB residence or family. 204 days jail credit.  Court imposes in 15CF523 sentence w/held 3 years probation concurrent to 16CF10:  Ct 1: 30 days jail with huber, $518.00, Ct 2: 30 days jail with huber concurrent to ct 1, $243.00, Ct 3: 30 days jail w huber concurrent to ct 1, $243.00,  DNA sample, absolute sobriety, AODA & follow through.  13 days jail credit. Jail is forthwith.
for argued plea/sentence on 7/26/16 @ 2:00 p.m.

Defendant Robert J Harvey in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No agreement.  Atty Benavides requested an argued plea/sentencing hearing.  He will get a date from the JA after Court today.

Cases called: 16CF3 & 16CF10, Defendant Robert J Harvey by jail video with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides in the courtroom.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Benavides motioned for reduction of bond. DA Kohlwey motioned for no bond reduction in either case. Rebuttal by Atty. Benavides. Court denied reduction; current bonds continued.
Return date on July 1, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
